title: 2 Timothy Chapter 4 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Timothy chapter 4 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Timothy Chapter 4 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Timothy Chapter 4.

questions.question: Who does Paul charge Timothy before in 2 Timothy 4:1?
options: God and the Lord Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: God and the Lord Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 4:1 states Paul charges Timothy before God and the Lord Jesus Christ.

questions.question: What is Timothy instructed to do 'in season, out of season' according to 2 Timothy 4:2?
questions.correctAnswer: Preach the word
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 4:2 commands Timothy to preach the word in season and out of season.

questions.question: What will people do when they will not endure sound doctrine, as stated in 2 Timothy 4:3?
options: Heap to themselves teachers having itching ears
questions.correctAnswer: Heap to themselves teachers having itching ears
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 4:3 explains people will seek teachers who satisfy their own lusts and itching ears.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 4:4, what will people turn away from?
questions.correctAnswer: The truth
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 4:4 says they will turn away their ears from the truth.

questions.question: What does Paul say he has done in 2 Timothy 4:7?
options: Fought a good fight, finished his course, and kept the faith
questions.correctAnswer: Fought a good fight, finished his course, and kept the faith
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 4:7 clearly states Paul has fought a good fight, finished his course, and kept the faith.

questions.question: Who has forsaken Paul because he loved the present world, according to 2 Timothy 4:10?
questions.correctAnswer: Demas
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 4:10 states Demas has forsaken Paul, loving this present world.

questions.question: Where did Crescens go as mentioned in 2 Timothy 4:10?
questions.correctAnswer: Galatia
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 4:10 states Crescens went to Galatia.

questions.question: Who is mentioned as being with Paul in 2 Timothy 4:11?
questions.correctAnswer: Luke
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 4:11 says only Luke is with Paul.

questions.question: Who did Paul send to Ephesus according to 2 Timothy 4:12?
questions.correctAnswer: Tychicus
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 4:12 mentions Paul sent Tychicus to Ephesus.

questions.question: What did Paul ask Timothy to bring from Troas in 2 Timothy 4:13?
questions.correctAnswer: The cloke, books, and parchments
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 4:13 requests Timothy to bring the cloke, books, and especially the parchments from Troas.

questions.question: Who did Paul warn Timothy to be wary of in 2 Timothy 4:14?
questions.correctAnswer: Alexander the coppersmith
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 4:14 warns Timothy to be aware of Alexander the coppersmith who did Paul much evil.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Timothy 4:16, at Paul's first defense, many stood with him.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 4:16 states that at Paul's first answer no man stood with him; all men forsook him.

questions.question: True or False: The Lord strengthened Paul so that the preaching might be fully known, as mentioned in 2 Timothy 4:17.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 4:17 confirms that the Lord stood with Paul and strengthened him for the preaching.

questions.question: True or False: Paul says in 2 Timothy 4:18 that the Lord will preserve him unto his earthly kingdom.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 4:18 states the Lord will preserve Paul unto his heavenly kingdom, not earthly.

questions.question: Complete the verse from 2 Timothy 4:22: 'The Lord Jesus Christ be with thy ______. Grace be with you. Amen.'
questions.correctAnswer: spirit
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 4:22 says 'The Lord Jesus Christ be with thy spirit.'

medium.title: 2 Timothy Chapter 4 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Timothy Chapter 4 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling to remain faithful in sharing the Gospel during difficult times. Based on 2 Timothy 4, what encouragement can you offer about perseverance?
options: Endure afflictions and do the work of an evangelist
Avoid trouble and wait for easier times
Focus only on personal growth and not ministry
Leave ministry to others when it's hard
questions.correctAnswer: Endure afflictions and do the work of an evangelist
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 4:5 encourages believers to watch in all things, endure afflictions, and do the work of an evangelist. This teaches perseverance and faithfulness in ministry despite hardships.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 4, how should a believer approach teaching and correction in difficult or unfavorable times?
options: Preach the word; reprove, rebuke, and exhort with patience and doctrine
Avoid confrontation and only speak when people agree
Preach only when convenient and popular
Ignore false teachings to keep peace
questions.correctAnswer: Preach the word; reprove, rebuke, and exhort with patience and doctrine
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 4:2 instructs to preach the word at all times, reprove, rebuke, and exhort with longsuffering and doctrine, emphasizing commitment to truth regardless of circumstances.

questions.question: A friend questions why some people reject sound biblical teaching. What reason does 2 Timothy 4 give for this behavior?
options: They prefer teachers who tell them what they want to hear
They love sound doctrine and seek wise teachers
They are always open to correction
They reject only the Old Testament
questions.correctAnswer: They prefer teachers who tell them what they want to hear
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 4:3 explains that people will not endure sound doctrine but will gather teachers with itching ears to suit their own lusts, indicating a preference for comfortable rather than truthful teaching.

questions.question: How does 2 Timothy 4 advise believers to guard themselves against false teachings?
options: Watch in all things and make full proof of ministry
questions.correctAnswer: Watch in all things and make full proof of ministry
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 4:5 urges vigilance and diligence in ministry to withstand false teachings and remain faithful, showing the importance of spiritual discipline and preparation.

questions.question: A believer is feeling discouraged after facing rejection while preaching. What encouragement does Paul give from his own experience in 2 Timothy 4?
options: The Lord stood with me and strengthened me
No one will ever reject you
Preach only to those who accept you
questions.correctAnswer: The Lord stood with me and strengthened me
questions.explanation: In 2 Timothy 4:17, Paul shares that though he was forsaken by all, the Lord stood with him and strengthened him, encouraging believers to trust God's presence during trials.

questions.question: How does 2 Timothy 4 describe the reward awaiting those who love Christ's appearing?
options: A crown of righteousness laid up by the Lord
questions.correctAnswer: A crown of righteousness laid up by the Lord
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 4:8 promises a crown of righteousness from the Lord, the righteous judge, to all who love His appearing, highlighting eternal reward for faithfulness.

questions.question: What practical advice does Paul give about ministry helpers in 2 Timothy 4?
options: Take Mark with you because he is profitable for ministry
Only work with those who never leave you
questions.correctAnswer: Take Mark with you because he is profitable for ministry
questions.explanation: In 2 Timothy 4:11, Paul asks Timothy to bring Mark because he is useful for ministry, showing the importance of fellowship and teamwork in serving God.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Timothy 4, Demas remained faithful and stayed with Paul until the end.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 4:10 states that Demas forsook Paul because he loved the present world and departed to Thessalonica, indicating unfaithfulness in difficult times.

questions.question: Based on 2 Timothy 4, what should be a believer's posture toward afflictions and trials?
options: Endure afflictions and continue faithful ministry
questions.correctAnswer: Endure afflictions and continue faithful ministry
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 4:5 teaches to endure afflictions and do the work of an evangelist, emphasizing perseverance and commitment even in hardships.

questions.question: What does Paul mean when he says, 'I have fought a good fight, I have finished my course, I have kept the faith'?
options: He remained faithful to Christ throughout his ministry
He stopped preaching after some time
He gave up when facing opposition
questions.correctAnswer: He remained faithful to Christ throughout his ministry
questions.explanation: In 2 Timothy 4:7, Paul reflects on his faithful endurance and completion of his ministry task, encouraging believers to remain steadfast in faith.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'For the time will come when they will not endure ________ doctrine; but after their own lusts shall they heap to themselves teachers.'
questions.correctAnswer: sound
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 4:3 warns that people will reject sound doctrine and follow teachers who tell them what they want to hear, highlighting the danger of drifting from truth.

questions.question: What does 2 Timothy 4 teach about relying on God's help during ministry challenges?
options: The Lord strengthens and delivers from evil
Ministers must depend only on themselves
questions.correctAnswer: The Lord strengthens and delivers from evil
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 4:17-18 shows that the Lord stood with Paul, strengthened him, delivered him from evil, and will preserve him for His kingdom, assuring believers of God's sustaining power.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Timothy 4, no one supported Paul at his first defense, but he prayed for them regardless.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 4:16 records that no one stood with Paul at his first defense and all deserted him, but Paul prayed that it not be counted against them, showing his forgiving spirit.

questions.question: How does 2 Timothy 4 illustrate the importance of spiritual discipline and preparation in ministry?
options: Make full proof of thy ministry by watching and enduring
Avoid hard work and rest often
questions.correctAnswer: Make full proof of thy ministry by watching and enduring
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 4:5 instructs believers to watch in all things, endure afflictions, and fully prove their ministry, highlighting disciplined commitment and diligence.

questions.question: What practical instruction does Paul give concerning Timothy's visit to him?
options: Do thy diligence to come shortly unto me
Wait until next year to visit
Send someone else in your place
questions.correctAnswer: Do thy diligence to come shortly unto me
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 4:9 and 4:21 both urge Timothy to come quickly before winter, emphasizing the urgency and importance of fellowship and support in ministry.

hard.title: 2 Timothy Chapter 4 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Timothy Chapter 4.

questions.question: In 2 Timothy 4:1, Paul charges Timothy before God and the Lord Jesus Christ who will judge the quick and the dead. What theological concept does this verse primarily emphasize?
options: The final judgment of all humanity
questions.correctAnswer: The final judgment of all humanity
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 4:1 highlights that Jesus Christ will judge both the living ('quick') and the dead at His appearing, emphasizing the doctrine of the final judgment.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 4:2, what attitude and method should Timothy use when preaching the word?
options: Instant in season and out of season, with longsuffering and doctrine
Only in favorable conditions, avoiding confrontation
questions.correctAnswer: Instant in season and out of season, with longsuffering and doctrine
questions.explanation: Verse 2 commands Timothy to preach at all times ('instant in season, out of season') and to use patience ('longsuffering') and sound teaching ('doctrine').

questions.question: What problem does Paul warn Timothy about in 2 Timothy 4:3 concerning future listeners of the gospel?
options: They will reject sound doctrine and seek teachers who satisfy their own desires
They will become physically ill and unable to hear
They will demand miracles before believing
They will only listen to apostles
questions.correctAnswer: They will reject sound doctrine and seek teachers who satisfy their own desires
questions.explanation: Verse 3 warns that people will not endure sound teaching and will accumulate teachers who tell them what they want to hear ('itching ears').

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 2 Timothy 4:4 says that they will turn their ears away from the truth and turn unto ______.
questions.correctAnswer: fables
questions.explanation: The verse explicitly states that people will 'turn away their ears from the truth, and shall be turned unto fables,' indicating a preference for myths or false stories over truth.

questions.question: What three-fold charge does Paul give Timothy in 2 Timothy 4:5?
options: Watch in all things, endure afflictions, do the work of an evangelist
Build a church, teach children, and write letters
Perform miracles, preach publicly, and baptize converts
Avoid persecution, seek wealth, and preach selectively
questions.correctAnswer: Watch in all things, endure afflictions, do the work of an evangelist
questions.explanation: Paul instructs Timothy to be vigilant, persevere through hardships, and actively evangelize, as stated in verse 5.

questions.question: In 2 Timothy 4:6-7, Paul uses metaphorical language about his life. What literary device is primarily used in the phrase 'I have fought a good fight, I have finished my course, I have kept the faith'?
options: Metaphor of athletic competition and race
Simile comparing life to a journey
questions.correctAnswer: Metaphor of athletic competition and race
questions.explanation: Paul uses metaphors of fighting and running a race to describe his faithful perseverance, common imagery in Greco-Roman culture.

questions.question: What reward does Paul say is laid up for him in 2 Timothy 4:8, and how is this reward characterized?
options: A crown of righteousness given by the righteous judge
A throne of glory given by the angels
A book of life written by God
A kingdom on earth granted to the saints
questions.correctAnswer: A crown of righteousness given by the righteous judge
questions.explanation: Verse 8 describes a 'crown of righteousness' that the Lord, as the righteous judge, will award to Paul and to all who love His appearing.

questions.question: Who does Paul say has forsaken him because he loved this present world, according to 2 Timothy 4:10?
questions.correctAnswer: Demas
questions.explanation: Demas is identified in verse 10 as the one who has abandoned Paul due to his love for the present world.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Timothy 4:11, Luke was the only companion with Paul at the time of this writing.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 11 explicitly states that 'Only Luke is with me,' indicating Luke was Paul's sole companion then.

questions.question: What item does Paul request Timothy to bring from Troas, as mentioned in 2 Timothy 4:13?
options: The cloak he left with Carpus
questions.correctAnswer: The cloak he left with Carpus
questions.explanation: Verse 13 asks Timothy to bring the cloak Paul left at Troas with Carpus, along with books and parchments.

questions.question: How does Paul describe Alexander the coppersmith in 2 Timothy 4:14, and what is the implied consequence?
options: He did Paul much evil; the Lord will reward him according to his works
He was a faithful helper; Paul commends him
He is a fellow evangelist; Paul sends greetings
He is a fellow prisoner; Paul asks for his release
questions.correctAnswer: He did Paul much evil; the Lord will reward him according to his works
questions.explanation: Verse 14 describes Alexander as one who caused Paul much harm and warns that the Lord will repay him justly.

questions.question: Analyze the parallelism between 2 Timothy 4:16 and 2 Timothy 4:17 regarding Paul's experience during his first defense. What contrast is expressed?
options: Weakness versus strength in the flesh
questions.correctAnswer: Human abandonment versus divine support
questions.explanation: Verse 16 notes no one stood with Paul, but verse 17 contrasts this by affirming that the Lord stood with and strengthened him, highlighting divine support despite human abandonment.

questions.question: In 2 Timothy 4:18, Paul expresses confidence in deliverance 'unto his heavenly kingdom.' How does this statement reflect the eschatological hope in the New Testament?
options: It affirms the believer's preservation until final glorification
It indicates withdrawal from the world into isolation
questions.correctAnswer: It affirms the believer's preservation until final glorification
questions.explanation: Paul's confidence in being preserved unto God's kingdom aligns with New Testament teachings on eternal life and final salvation.

questions.question: What is the significance of Paul sending greetings to Prisca and Aquila, and the household of Onesiphorus, in 2 Timothy 4:19, in the context of early Christian community?
options: It shows the importance of faithful Christian households and co-laborers
It indicates they were rulers in the Roman government
It implies they were Paul's biological relatives
It suggests they were recipients of Paul's prison epistles
questions.correctAnswer: It shows the importance of faithful Christian households and co-laborers
questions.explanation: Prisca and Aquila were known as key partners in ministry, indicating the value of community and support in early Christian mission.

questions.question: Which individuals does Paul mention in 2 Timothy 4:20 as being at specific locations, and what does this reveal about missionary activity in the early church?
options: Erastus at Corinth, Trophimus left sick at Miletum
Peter at Rome, John at Ephesus
James in Jerusalem, Barnabas in Cyprus
Silas in Antioch, Timothy in Lystra
questions.correctAnswer: Erastus at Corinth, Trophimus left sick at Miletum
questions.explanation: Paul's mention of these locations reveals the geographical spread and personal concerns within early missionary journeys.

theological.title: 2 Timothy Chapter 4 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Timothy Chapter 4 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 4:1, before whom does Paul charge Timothy to preach the word faithfully?
options: God and the Lord Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: God and the Lord Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Paul charges Timothy before God and the Lord Jesus Christ who will judge the living and the dead, emphasizing divine authority and eschatological accountability (2 Timothy 4:1). This aligns with Acts 10:42, Romans 14:10, and Revelation 20:12 where God and Christ are the ultimate judges.

questions.question: What attitude does Paul instruct Timothy to have when preaching the word according to 2 Timothy 4:2?
options: Be instant in season and out of season
questions.correctAnswer: Be instant in season and out of season
questions.explanation: Paul exhorts Timothy to preach the word persistently, regardless of circumstances, reflecting the urgency and perseverance required in ministry (2 Timothy 4:2). This is consistent with Jesus' command to preach the gospel to all nations (Matthew 28:19), and Paul's own example in Acts 20:24 and Romans 1:16.

questions.question: What does 2 Timothy 4:3 say people will do when they no longer endure sound doctrine?
options: Heap to themselves teachers after their own lusts
Build up the church with good works
questions.correctAnswer: Heap to themselves teachers after their own lusts
questions.explanation: Paul warns that people will reject sound doctrine and follow teachers who tell them what they want to hear, illustrating human sinful nature and the danger of false teaching (2 Timothy 4:3). Similar warnings appear in Jeremiah 23:16-17, Matthew 15:14, and 2 Peter 2:1-3.

questions.question: In 2 Timothy 4:4, what will people turn away from, and to what will they turn?
options: Turn away from the truth and turn unto fables
Turn away from the law and turn unto grace
Turn away from the prophets and turn unto the apostles
Turn away from the Gentiles and turn unto the Jews
questions.correctAnswer: Turn away from the truth and turn unto fables
questions.explanation: The verse highlights apostasy where people reject biblical truth and embrace myths or deceitful stories, reflecting a departure from divine revelation (2 Timothy 4:4). This connects with Ezekiel 13:6, Isaiah 44:20, and Titus 1:14 which warn against false teachings and fables.

questions.question: What does Paul instruct Timothy to do in 2 Timothy 4:5 in response to these challenges?
options: Watch in all things, endure afflictions, do the work of an evangelist, make full proof of thy ministry
Focus only on teaching in the synagogue
questions.correctAnswer: Watch in all things, endure afflictions, do the work of an evangelist, make full proof of thy ministry
questions.explanation: Paul charges Timothy to be vigilant, endure hardship, evangelize, and fully carry out his ministry despite opposition (2 Timothy 4:5). This mirrors Christ's call to endure persecution (Matthew 10:22), Paul's own example (Acts 20:24), and the call to faithful ministry (1 Corinthians 9:16).

questions.question: How does Paul describe his life and ministry in 2 Timothy 4:7?
options: I have fought a good fight, finished my course, and kept the faith
I have built many churches and gained many followers
I have avoided all suffering and remained safe
I have preached only to the Jews
questions.correctAnswer: I have fought a good fight, finished my course, and kept the faith
questions.explanation: Paul uses athletic and race metaphors to describe his faithful perseverance and completion of his ministry (2 Timothy 4:7). This aligns with similar language in 1 Corinthians 9:24-27 and Hebrews 12:1-2 about enduring to the end in faith.

questions.question: What is promised to Paul and all who love Christ’s appearing according to 2 Timothy 4:8?
questions.correctAnswer: A crown of righteousness
questions.explanation: Paul speaks of a righteous crown reserved for himself and all believers who eagerly await Christ’s return, emphasizing eschatological reward (2 Timothy 4:8). This is consistent with James 1:12, Revelation 2:10, and 1 Peter 5:4 which speak of crowns for faithful believers.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 4:10, why did Demas forsake Paul?
questions.correctAnswer: Having loved this present world
questions.explanation: Paul states Demas left because of his love for the world, illustrating the danger of worldly attachment that can lead to abandoning faithfulness (2 Timothy 4:10). This theme is echoed in 1 John 2:15-16 and James 4:4 about love of the world being incompatible with love for God.

questions.question: Who does Paul say is profitable for the ministry in 2 Timothy 4:11?
questions.correctAnswer: Mark
questions.explanation: Paul requests that Timothy bring Mark because he is helpful for ministry, demonstrating the value of faithful coworkers (2 Timothy 4:11). This aligns with other mentions of Mark’s usefulness in Colossians 4:10 and Philemon 1:24.

questions.question: In 2 Timothy 4:14, what does Paul say about Alexander the coppersmith?
options: He did much evil to Paul
He was a brother in Christ
questions.correctAnswer: He did much evil to Paul
questions.explanation: Paul warns Timothy about Alexander who opposed him and caused harm, exemplifying opposition to the gospel (2 Timothy 4:14). This parallels warnings about false teachers in Acts 13:10 and 2 Timothy 3:13.

questions.question: What does Paul say happened to him at his first defense in 2 Timothy 4:16?
options: No one stood with him; all men forsook him
He was supported by the elders
questions.correctAnswer: No one stood with him; all men forsook him
questions.explanation: Paul recounts being abandoned at his first defense, highlighting the reality of suffering and loneliness in ministry (2 Timothy 4:16). This is echoed in Psalm 31:11, Isaiah 53:3, and Hebrews 13:5 about God’s presence despite human abandonment.

questions.question: Despite being forsaken, what does Paul say happened in 2 Timothy 4:17?
options: The Lord stood with him and strengthened him
questions.correctAnswer: The Lord stood with him and strengthened him
questions.explanation: Paul affirms that God’s presence empowered him to preach fully and deliver him from danger, emphasizing divine sovereignty and providence (2 Timothy 4:17). This aligns with Psalm 46:1, Isaiah 41:10, and Philippians 4:13.

questions.question: What does Paul ask Timothy to bring when he comes, according to 2 Timothy 4:13?
options: The cloak, books, and especially the parchments
Food and drink for the journey
Money and gifts for the church
questions.correctAnswer: The cloak, books, and especially the parchments
questions.explanation: Paul requests Timothy to bring personal items including a cloak and important writings, showing practical needs and the value of Scripture or notes (2 Timothy 4:13). This reflects the early Christian emphasis on preserving apostolic writings (John 20:31, Colossians 4:16).

questions.question: Who does Paul greet in 2 Timothy 4:19?
options: Prisca, Aquila, and the household of Onesiphorus
questions.correctAnswer: Prisca, Aquila, and the household of Onesiphorus
questions.explanation: Paul sends greetings to these faithful companions, indicating the close relationships within the early church and honoring those who supported ministry (2 Timothy 4:19). Prisca and Aquila are mentioned in Romans 16:3 and Acts 18:2; Onesiphorus is commended in 2 Timothy 1:16-18.

questions.question: What assurance about his future does Paul express in 2 Timothy 4:18?
options: The Lord will deliver him from every evil work and preserve him unto His heavenly kingdom
He will be immediately released from prison
He will return to Jerusalem in victory
He will gain great earthly wealth
questions.correctAnswer: The Lord will deliver him from every evil work and preserve him unto His heavenly kingdom
questions.explanation: Paul expresses confidence in God’s ultimate deliverance and preservation unto eternal life, reflecting trust in divine protection and eschatological hope (2 Timothy 4:18). This corresponds with Psalm 121:7-8, John 10:28, and Romans 8:38-39.
